alert.note: Alert for Ashland; Bayfield; Douglas; Iron (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 04 at 11:27AM CST until January 04 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Greater accumulations of 3 to 6 inches for the higher terrain of the Bayfield Peninsula. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Douglas, Bayfield, Ashland and Iron Counties. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Bad River Reservation and the Red Cliff Band. * WHEN...Until 6 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. Do not use cruise control in winter driving conditions.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.
